title: UNICEF_Report_on_C-Section_Births
text:
Why It Matters
Overuse of C-sections can lead to unnecessary medical risks for mothers and babies. Underuse of C-sections can lead to preventable deaths in cases where surgical intervention is necessary. The procedure is not evenly accessible, reflecting healthcare inequality.

title: UNICEF_Report_on_C-Section_Births
text:
A Global Perspective
This report explores the rate of C-section births globally using UNICEF indicators. Our analysis includes: C-section Rates by Country (Most Recent Year) C-section rate - percentage of deliveries Global C-section Rate Over Time C-section Rate Over Time in Yemen

title: UNICEF_Report_on_C-Section_Births
section: By visualizing these patterns, we aim to raise awareness about the inequalities and challenges surrounding childbirth practices worldwide. These insights are critical for shaping health policies that ensure safe, accessible, and appropriate maternal care for all.
text:
By visualizing these patterns, we aim to raise awareness about the inequalities and challenges surrounding childbirth practices worldwide. These insights are critical for shaping health policies that ensure safe, accessible, and appropriate maternal care for all.
This is a Quarto website.
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/website

library(tidyverse)

library(sf)

Linking to GEOS 3.13.1, GDAL 3.10.2, PROJ 9.5.1; sf_use_s2() is TRUE

library(rnaturalearth)
library(rnaturalearthdata)


Attaching package: 'rnaturalearthdata'

The following object is masked from 'package:rnaturalearth':

    countries110



df1 <- read_csv("unicef_indicator_1.csv", show_col_types = FALSE)
df2 <- read_csv("unicef_indicator_2.csv", show_col_types = FALSE)
meta <- read_csv("unicef_metadata.csv", show_col_types = FALSE)


combined <- bind_rows(df1, df2)


full_data <- combined %>%
  left_join(meta, by = c("country", "alpha_3_code"))

Warning in left_join(., meta, by = c("country", "alpha_3_code")): Detected an unexpected many-to-many relationship between `x` and `y`.
ℹ Row 1 of `x` matches multiple rows in `y`.
ℹ Row 1 of `y` matches multiple rows in `x`.
ℹ If a many-to-many relationship is expected, set `relationship =
  "many-to-many"` to silence this warning.



# Filter only C-section data
csection_data <- full_data %>%
  filter(indicator == "C-section rate - percentage of deliveries by cesarean section") %>%
  group_by(country) %>%
  filter(time_period == max(time_period)) %>%
  ungroup()

# Load and join with spatial map
world <- ne_countries(scale = "medium", returnclass = "sf")
world_data <- world %>%
  left_join(csection_data, by = c("name" = "country"))

# Plot
ggplot(world_data) +
  geom_sf(aes(fill = obs_value)) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c(option = "C", na.value = "gray90") +
  labs(title = "C-section Rates by Country (Most Recent Year)", fill = "%") +
  theme_minimal()









top10 <- full_data %>% 
  filter(indicator == "C-section rate - percentage of deliveries by cesarean section") %>%
  group_by(country) %>%
  filter(time_period == max(time_period)) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  arrange(desc(obs_value)) %>%
  slice_head(n = 10)

# Check that the data passed to ggplot is filtered correctly
latest_data <- full_data %>%
  filter(indicator == "C-section rate - percentage of deliveries by cesarean section") %>%
  filter(time_period == max(time_period))

# Plot the data
ggplot(latest_data, aes(x = reorder(country, obs_value), y = obs_value)) + 
  geom_col(fill = "steelblue") + 
  coord_flip() + 
  labs(
    title = "C-section Rate by Country",
    x = "Country",
    y = "C-section Rate (%)"
  ) + 
  theme_minimal()









ggplot(csection_data, aes(x = time_period, y = obs_value)) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.4) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", color = "red", se = FALSE) +
  labs(title = "Global C-section Rate Over Time", x = "Year", y = "%") +
  theme_minimal()

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'










yemen_trend <- csection_data %>% filter(country == "Yemen")

ggplot(yemen_trend, aes(x = time_period, y = obs_value)) +
  geom_line(color = "blue") +
  geom_point() +
  labs(title = "C-section Rate Over Time in Yemen", x = "Year", y = "%") +
  theme_minimal()
